com.htc.lib1.duallens

Class Geometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.htc.lib1.duallens.Geometry

  • public class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
    The 3D geometry data is generated from DimensionPlus. The 3D geometry is described three components, vertex data, texture coordinates, and index data.
    Version:
    Feb, 14, 2014, Document version: March, 04, 2014

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Geometry()
      Default geometry constructor Create a new empty geometry.
      Geometry(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexArray, java.nio.FloatBuffer texcoordArray, java.nio.ShortBuffer indexArray)
      Create a new geometry with the specified vertex data, index data, and texture coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clear all geometry data.
      java.nio.ShortBuffer getIndices()
      Get index array from geometry.
      java.nio.FloatBuffer getTextureCoordinates()
      Get texture coordinates data from geometry.
      java.nio.FloatBuffer getVertices()
      Get vertex array from geometry.
      void setIndices(java.nio.ShortBuffer indexArray)
      Set index data to this geometry.
      void setTextureCoordinates(java.nio.FloatBuffer texcoordArray)
      Set texture coordinates data to this geometry.
      void setVertices(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexArray)
      Set vertex array from geometry.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Geometry

        public Geometry()
        Default geometry constructor Create a new empty geometry. All vertex data, index data, and texture coordinates are initialized to null.

      • Geometry

        public Geometry(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexArray,
        java.nio.FloatBuffer texcoordArray,
        java.nio.ShortBuffer indexArray)
        Create a new geometry with the specified vertex data, index data, and texture coordinates. Notes:
        Parameters:
        vertexArray - Specifies an array that contains vertex position data of this geometry.
        texcoordArray - Specifies an array that contains texture coordinate data of each vertex in this geometry.
        indexArray - Specifies an array that is stored indices data at this geometry. The primitives that are constructed by indices is triangles.

    • Method Detail

      • getVertices

        public java.nio.FloatBuffer getVertices()
        Get vertex array from geometry.
        Returns:
        Vertex array of geometry.

      • setVertices

        public void setVertices(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexArray)
        Set vertex array from geometry.
        Parameters:
        vertexArray - Specifies an array that contains vertex position data of this geometry.

      • getTextureCoordinates

        public java.nio.FloatBuffer getTextureCoordinates()
        Get texture coordinates data from geometry.
        Returns:
        Texture coordinates.

      • setTextureCoordinates

        public void setTextureCoordinates(java.nio.FloatBuffer texcoordArray)
        Set texture coordinates data to this geometry.
        Parameters:
        texcoordArray - Specifies an array that contains texture coordinate data of each vertex in this geometry.

      • getIndices

        public java.nio.ShortBuffer getIndices()
        Get index array from geometry.
        Returns:
        Index array of geometry.

      • setIndices

        public void setIndices(java.nio.ShortBuffer indexArray)
        Set index data to this geometry.
        Parameters:
        indexArray - Specifies an array that is stored indices data at this geometry. The primitives that are constructed by indices is triangles.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all geometry data.
